Key Match Events: Ryan Helsley recorded the game-ending save with a 42nd save in 45 tries, securing the Cardinals' first win at the new Yankee Stadium since 2009 and their first over the Yankees in the Bronx since 1964.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Gibson, the winning pitcher, commented on the historical significance of the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The play-by-play voices for the game were both named Caray, similar to the 1964 game.
Others: Ryan Helsley's performance was highlighted, with his use of finesse pitches to outwit the hitter.
